intro: Pedicularis salviiflora, commonly known as the purple monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, known for its parasitic or hemiparasitic growth habits. The plant features showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are erect and branched. Pedicularis salviiflora thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in meadows and forest clearings.
